data.title: Roboflow’s Python Pip Package For Computer Vision
data.description: Regardless of whether your project is a new product line, a new industrial production system, a research project, or a personal one to help you learn what computer vision is all about, you'll want to add "pip install roboflow" to your code - and here's why.

data.title: Roboflow Changelog: April 2022
data.description: April showers brings May flowers, and here's a bouquet of flower datasets from Roboflow Universe you can use today!

data.title: Cinco de Mayo, Beer and Taco Dataset with Multi-Label Classification
data.description: A multi-label classification dataset to detect some favorite Cinco de Mayo food used to celebrate the holiday here in the United States

data.title: Machine vision applications with wearable devices
data.description: XR Tech uses a body mounted camera, and streams media to machine vision models trained using Roboflow to produce a “smart” safety system.

data.title: Art Recognition with a Computer Vision Model
data.description: This model predicts what artistic movement and style a painting falls within. Predictions span from Early Renaissance to Pop Art. Try it yourself

data.title: What is Instance Segmentation? A Guide with Roboflow.
data.description: We are excited to release support for instance segmentation projects on Roboflow.  Instance segmentation allows your computer vision model to know the specific outline of an object in an image, unlocking new use cases for Roboflow in your application.

data.title: How to Train Detectron2 for Custom Instance Segmentation
data.description: A walk through on how to train Detectron2 to segment your custom objects from any image by providing our model with example training data.

data.title: Roboflow Changelog: March 2022
data.description: Spring is finally here and there is computer vision in the air! Each month, we share a recap of product and company updates, read more here.

data.title: Launch: End to End Multi-Label Classification
data.description: Multi-label classification lets your model learn and predict multiple classes for a given image instead of just one.

data.title: The Ultimate Computer Vision Deployment Guide (Which Computer Vision Deployment Method is Best for You?)
data.description: The data you work with will greatly influence how you deploy your model. Selecting the correct deployment method is a simple decision.

data.title: Computer Vision Saves 4.95 Billion Internet Users from Rickrolling
data.description: Roboflow, a software business that builds tools for developers to use computer vision, is releasing Real-time Intrusion Checker Kernel (RICK)

data.title: How many images do you need to train a model?
data.description: A model can work with 100 images or with 10,000. It  depends on what you are doing and the level of accuracy required for you to use your model.

data.title: Improving Computer Vision Datasets and Models
data.description: Common tips and tricks to improve your computer or machine vision dataset, including using Roboflow Train and the Dataset Health Check tools.

data.title: CVAT - Getting Started with  Computer Vision Annotation Tool
data.description: In this post, learn about CVAT's ability to make object detection annotations on images. See the steps used to annotate a public aerial dataset.

data.title: Convert Annotation Formats EASY (26 available Formats 😱)
data.description: Computer vision datasets come in many formats, and sometimes they’re less than ideal. We solve this problem by offering 26 annotations formats.

data.title: Introducing New and Improved Roboflow Train
data.description: We incorporated advancements in computer vision research and learnings from users to create new training and deployment infrastructure.

data.title: What to Think About When Choosing Model Sizes
data.description: When training any machine learning model, you must trade off inference speed for accuracy. Larger models with more parameters are uniformly more accurate, and smaller models with fewer parameters are uniformly faster to infer.

data.title: Building a U.S. License Plate Detection Model And Sharing It On Roboflow Universe
data.description: Building a U.S. license plate object detection model with open source dataset using Roboflow and computer vision.

data.title: Roboflow Changelog: February 2022
data.description: Even though it's the shortest month of the year, we accomplished a lot!

data.title: Precision and Recall in Machine Learning
data.description: Understand how precision and recall affect your model's performance and choose when to optimize between precision or recall.

data.title: Testing A Computer Vision Model In 10 Seconds Or Less
data.description: You can test a model by selecting either a file from your device or dragging and dropping one on the screen

data.title: How To Avoid Bias In Computer Vision Models
data.description: Today we’re going to dive into the technical side of avoiding bias in computer vision models, to give you an introduction into the topic.

data.title: Identifying Chocolates With Computer Vision
data.description: It’s Valentine’s Day, and your sweetheart has given you a beautiful box of chocolates. You pick out a delicious looking bonbon, bite into it, and…it’s your least favorite filling. How disappointing! To avoid this type of heartbreak, some people resort to nibbling corners, or poking a

data.title: How to Train Computer Vision Models on Aerial Imagery
data.description: Aerial imagery are images taken from aircrafts like drones, planes, and helicopters. With these images we can train a model to detect objects like fires, buildings, solar panels, rooftops, maritime search and rescue, and more. A good use case example is when maritime search and rescue (SAR) teams search for

data.title: Roboflow Changelog: January 2022
data.description: It might be cold outside, but Roboflow is bringing the heat to kick off 2022! Each month, we share a recap of product and company updates; if you missed last month's edition of the Roboflow Changelog, you can find it here. Roboflow Organize Major update to the Annotations workflow making

data.title: Launch: Collaborative Annotations
data.description: Roboflow Annotate has become an essential tool used by tens of thousands of developers to label images of everything from planes to petri dishes. Since its launch just over a year ago, it has made creating training data for your computer vision models simple and fast. But there's more to

data.title: Introducing the Roboflow Universe Dataset Research Internship
data.description: We are seeking an intern who would be interested in first-authoring the paper that introduces the Roboflow Universe Datasets.

data.title: Roboflow Changelog: December 2021
data.description: Even though the year was coming to a close and holidays gave us the chance to spend time with family and friends, we kept our focus right up to the end in order to make Roboflow even better. Each month, we share a recap of product and company updates to

data.title: SageMaker Studio Lab vs Google Colab
data.description: Recently, AWS released SageMaker Studio Lab, its competitor service to Google Colab. I dove into comparing Google Colab to Studio Lab and here is what I found.

data.title: Introducing the Roboflow Inference Widget
data.description: Now, you can easily test any model that has been trained with Roboflow Train by dragging an image file onto your dataset version page.
